Pando Media Booster alone prevented anyone at my college from downloading League. Our internet has anti-P2P protocols and we are literally in the middle of nowhere, so there aren't many other options to get the game. Thank you based Rito.
They are implementing their own P2P if you had read the post, your problems are not over.

That's a great point.  As we're investigating different P2P implementations, how well it plays on big networks - especially college networks - are certainly on our radar.  

At minimum we'll give you all a way to opt out of it so that you can still download and play.

Well, no matter what you do, you will have the portion of the community who simply do not want to be involved in the P2P. I would suggest having it as an optional thing, on the download page have a check box for opting into the P2P system (with a small description of what it does) which is by default enabled.
This is a great suggestion.  Control over your download experience is super important to us so at a minimum you'll be able to opt-out of whatever P2P system we decide to go with.
is this a PC only thing?

We actually never used Pando Media Booster on Mac so, technically, yes the removal will only be for PC.

As far the P2P system we're investigating it will be used by both Mac and PC gamers.
but what about the xbox players?
You should add the p2p system for linux users, and then make the game native on linux in that order.
Pando media booster does not boost my media, thank you riot o, o
And I'm sure 75% of people that play League had no idea what this even was
God these spammers are so fucking annoying. Can you guys not IP ban them or something? :\

If they knew what they were doing, I don't think they would make it look so stupidly obvious.
I don't get it. What's the difference between using Pando and using their own peer to peer software. Why reinvent the wheel?

Good question.  Why would Riot want to move to a different system than Pando P2P to provide P2P downloads?  First off, Pando P2P shut down a while ago which means that all of your LoL patches and installs have been using traditional download methods (like straight from a central server).  
 
We think that having a method to get patches from players near you is important because of two things: First, the latency between players on your local network or subnet can be faster than connections to a more centralized distribution system.  Second, having many ways to download updates makes the system overall much more resilient against network errors and minor hiccups.

Pando has been Defunt for a while and as of now causes too many problems. The point of having the p2p system in place was to roll out patches with higher speeds. Unfortunately the Pando Software has had a habit of Slowing your computer to shit.

By making their OWN p2p service for League, they can have the benefits of faster patching and simultaneously keep the service updated so as to not melt your system.
I'm actually pretty happy about this.  Pando you piece of junk!!! I have ended the process in rage many times just cuz I could.  So happy to be rid of it soon.

You can actually just delete it off of your computer right now if you want.  As long as no other games you play depend on it you can remove through your "Add/Remove Programs" screen in the Control Panel.

The future system we're working on will simply make it that much easier for players.
wait, some other games depend on pando as well? i thought riot's things were riot's things, and blizz's things were theirs, and etc!

pando is third party program, so its not "riots things". As long as the developer of a game works it out with pando then it can be used. but i cant think of any other games off the top of my head that use pando.

So, does the Panda Media Booster slow down League on my computer? Also, will the P2P program slow League down?

I have a 6+ year old laptop, still on Vista, I don't want to be left behind ;-(

Yes it does slow down your computer. Pando being removed is a positive, for it takes some of the "energy" from your computer! It is being removed, Think of it as switching a dorans blade for an Infinity Edge!
So I'm losing 3% lifesteal? :/
Don't forget you're losing that 70 hp too.
If we already deleted it will it prompt me to delete it?
Nope!  When this system goes live it will only prompt you to delete it if it is still detected on your computer.
Is deleting it optional?
Yup.  Deleting it is totally optional.  It simply doesn't do anything for LoL patches anymore and, as such, just is another piece of complexity in our patching process that doesn't add value.
Fan of complexity, Confirmed
